beef.Name: Oven-baked Beef Shank with Creamy Polenta
beef.Instructions: I started by taking the meat out of the fridge 40 minutes before cooking to bring it to room temperature. I washed and dried the beef shank with paper towels to ensure it had a dry surface. I heated a pan with some oil on medium-high heat and dusted the beef with flour. I tied the meat to keep it compact, then seared it on both sides until golden brown. I added butter, garlic cloves, and aromatic herbs to the pan and let them cook for a minute. I preheated the oven to 170℃. I placed the seared meat in a heatproof dish with the broth, green onions, parsnip, carrots, celery, and some water to cover the meat slightly. I covered the dish with aluminum foil and cooked it for 2 hours.

beef.Name: Beef Wellington
beef.Instructions: I used the center cut of the beef tenderloin for even cooking. I seared the seasoned beef in a hot pan to seal in the juices and ensure it remained tender. I baked the beef in the oven at 170℃ for about 10 minutes until the center temperature reached 50℃. Once out of the oven, I brushed the beef with Dijon mustard while still hot, wrapped it tightly in cling film, and refrigerated it for 15 minutes. I chopped mushrooms finely and sautéed them with red onion in olive oil. I laid out a sheet of cling film, placed thin ham slices overlapping slightly, spread the mushroom mixture on top, and wrapped the beef in this layer. After refrigerating again, I wrapped the beef in puff pastry, brushed it with egg wash, and baked it at 200℃ for about an hour until the pastry turned golden. After resting for 15 minutes, it was ready to serve.

beef.Name: Oven-baked Beef Ribs in Red Wine
beef.Instructions: I started by searing the seasoned beef ribs in olive oil until golden brown. I transferred them to a roasting pan, covered them with red wine, and cooked them in the oven at 200℃ for about 4 hours, adding beef broth halfway through. Meanwhile, I prepared the vegetables: I glazed carrots in olive oil, butter, and honey and roasted them for 30 minutes. I made a creamy celery puree by boiling celery, blending it with butter and milk, and seasoning it. I also pickled beets and added horseradish for a spicy kick. I served the beef ribs with the celery puree, roasted carrots, and pickled beets.

beef.Name: Sirloin Steak with Blanched Vegetables
beef.Instructions: I let the sirloin steak rest at room temperature for about 25-30 minutes before cooking. I blanched the vegetables (carrots, cauliflower, and broccoli) in boiling salted water for 2 minutes, then sautéed them in butter for 5 minutes. I seasoned the sirloin steak with salt and pepper and seared it in a hot grill pan with butter, cooking it for 5 minutes on each side. I served the steak with the blanched vegetables.

beef.Name: Beef with Cinnamon Sauce
beef.Instructions: I started by boiling cubed potatoes in milk with a cinnamon stick until soft, then mashed them with butter to create a cinnamon-flavored puree. I seared beef steaks, then deglazed the pan with red wine and beef stock, adding cinnamon for flavor. After simmering, I added butter mixed with flour to thicken the sauce. I served the beef with the cinnamon sauce alongside the mashed potatoes.
